Subhas Chandra Bose's establishment of the Free Indian Legion demonstrated his determination to use any means necessary to achieve India's independence. Despite the controversial nature of his alliance with the Axis powers, Bose's efforts to mobilize Indian troops and create a united front against British imperialism were seen as significant contributions to the Indian freedom struggle.
It is important to note that while Subhas Chandra Bose's actions and alliances may have been controversial, his contributions to the Indian freedom struggle and his role in raising the Free Indian Legion are undeniable. His efforts inspired many Indians and left a lasting impact on the fight for independence.
